xmlmc

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bittercreektech.xmlmc.Request

  • public class Request
extends java.lang.Object
    Request.java

    Represents a request to send to the server. Handles the building of xml in the appropriate structure through simple method calls.

      Generate a new request

      • Request

        public Request(java.lang.String service,
               java.lang.String method)
        Generate a new request
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • setParam

        public void setParam(java.lang.String param,
                     java.lang.String value)
        Create a simple parameter. When converted to a string it looks like 
        <param>Value</param>
        Parameters:
        param - The name of the param element
        value - The value the parameter should hold

      • setParam

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • setParam

        public void setParam(SwType param)

      • prepComplexParam

        public ComplexParam prepComplexParam(java.lang.String param)
        Create complex params. When converted to a string they take the format 
        <param>
 <something>
 Value
 </something>
 </param>
        Parameters:
        param - Name of the parent xml element for the parameter
        Returns:
        new ComplexParam

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a string representation of the xml
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Xml String of the format 
        <methodCall service="service" method="method">
 <params>
 <paramName>
 Value
 </paramName>
 </params>
 </methodCall>

      • getXmlDocument

        public org.w3c.dom.Document getXmlDocument()
        Return the actual xml Document object
        Returns:
        Document object of the request. If you want the xml string, use the toString() method
